conclusion: Determine the width of the portion of the base through which light passes using Snell's law and total internal reflection properties.
The angle of incidence on the flat base is given as π - γ and the critical angle for total internal reflection is γ.
Using Snell's law, n sin(π - γ) = n sin(θ1) implies sin(θ1) = sin(γ), thus θ1 = γ.
The angle of incidence on the curved surface is θ2 = π/2 - γ.
For the light to pass through the curved surface, sin(θ3) = sin(θ2) = cos(γ), thus θ3 = γ.
The width of the portion of the base through which light passes is 2R sin(γ).
